TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit XamlDuplicateMemberException extends System.Xaml.XamlException

Docs.summary: The exception that is thrown when a XAML writer attempts to write a value for a duplicate member into the same object node.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If you handle this exception from a XAML node stream, members might be reported as duplicates in several possible situations. For example, an explicit property element for a XAML content property might be preceded by whitespace that is interpreted as content, if the collection is whitespace significant. Or the XAML writer might be attempting to reset a property that should instead be using a `GetObject` default value. If you analyze individual nodes in the XAML node stream, you can often determine the source of the problem.
If a XAML object writer provides special handing for duplicate members, it can prevent some duplicate member exceptions if you specify <xref:System.Xaml.XamlObjectWriterSettings.SkipDuplicatePropertyCheck%2A> as `true` in <xref:System.Xaml.XamlObjectWriterSettings> that initialize the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlObjectWriter>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string message, class System.Exception innerException) cil managed

Docs.param: The message that describes the exception. The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception. If the innerException parameter is not , the current exception is raised in a block that handles the inner exception.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.

remarks.format: ## Remarks An exception that is thrown as a direct result of a previous exception should include a reference to the previous exception in the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property. The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property returns the same value that is passed into the constructor, or `null` if the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property does not supply the inner exception value to the constructor.

Gets or sets the XAML member identifier for the property to report as a duplicate.
Docs.value: The object (XAML member identifier) to report.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor is called during deserialization to reconstitute the exception object that is transmitted over a stream.

Docs.permission: requires full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted or transparent code.
